definition: parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

sentences.english: Now in the campus, there many intimate lovers walking around.
sentences.chinese: 現在在校園裏，親暱的情侶隨處可見。

sentences.english: Explain to him that sexual intimacy is ery important to you.
sentences.chinese: 向他解釋性親暱行爲對你來說是多麼重要。

sentences.english: Respect your spouse's right to privacy; individual space is important.
sentences.chinese: 尊重愛侶的私密，親暱的關係更需要空間。

sentences.english: His excessive familiarity made her uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他過分的親暱使她不舒服。

sentences.english: When the tender wife seeks her husband's society, he comes to her on wings of love.
sentences.chinese: 溫柔的妻子向丈夫親暱示好，丈夫就投入她的懷抱。

sentences.english: Ginny Weasley (Bonnie Wright) and Harry grow closer, even when his destiny threatens to pull them apart.
sentences.chinese: 小金妮和哈利日漸親暱，但命運卻要把兩人分開。

sentences.english: Talk about your needs and how you feel when you're at that just-right level of physical closeness.
sentences.chinese: 交流下你的需求和你在恰當的肉體親暱水平上的感受。

sentences.english: They broke the news director in the studio too intimate, non-stop kissing people can not stand.
sentences.chinese: 導演爆料兩人在片場太過親暱，不停親嘴讓人受不了。

sentences.english: Jocelyn and I made dinner, drank wine, nuzzled on the couch.
sentences.chinese: 喬斯林和我用了晚餐，喝紅酒，然後在沙發上親暱。

sentences.english: Rosie gave her an affectionate kiss on each cheek.
sentences.chinese: 羅西在她的臉蛋上每邊親暱地吻了一下。

sentences.english: I had an intimate connection with the place.
sentences.chinese: 我對這個地方有着一種親暱感。

sentences.english: Over-sharing may also suggest a level of intimacy he is not yet ready for.
sentences.chinese: 過分分享會形成一種他並沒有準備接受的親暱關係。

definition: to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
